medical_history.chief_complaint: Painful degenerative arthritis of both hips.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented in 1976 at age 33. He had previously undergone a left proximal femoral osteotomy at age 7, initially suspected to be a slipped capital femoral epiphysis. Symptoms of arthritis progressed, leading to difficulties in mobility.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic osteomyelitis of the right tibia (1984), pathological fractures in both tibiae (1990), and stress fractures in the right femur (2002) and left femur (2003).
medical_history.family_history: Three brothers were affected by pyknodysostosis, one of whom had a hip arthroplasty eleven years prior.
